bug.author: alinaselega
bug.summary: Default values not listed for hyperparameters in tfp ExponentiatedQuadratic class
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/probability/api_docs/python/tfp/positive_semidefinite_kernels/ExponentiatedQuadratic>https://www.tensorflow.org/probability/api_docs/python/tfp/positive_semidefinite_kernels/ExponentiatedQuadratic</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
List default values for hyperparameters and that are used when a kernel is created with default values, as suggested <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/probability/api_docs/python/tfp/distributions/GaussianProcess#examples>here</denchmark-link> : <denchmark-code>tfd = tfp.distributions psd_kernels = tfp.positive_semidefinite_kernels
# Define a kernel with default parameters. kernel = psd_kernels.ExponentiatedQuadratic() </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Parameters defined</denchmark-h>
Default values for amplitude and length_scale are not listed (apart from a keyword 'None').

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/alinaselega>@alinaselega</denchmark-link> This is more related to repo. Please post it in tfp repo <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/probability/issues>here</denchmark-link> and close this issue. Thanks!
